page.title: 13THE VILLAGE
page.content: MR JOHN RUSSELL LIVED IN BISHOP'S HOUSE AND IT WAS HERE THAT LORD ROBERTS ONE STAYED.THERE WAS A ROW OF 10 COTTAGES ON THE LAND. WHICH IS NOW THE GARDEN OF BISHOP'S HOUSE NEAR THE OLD CHAPEL. ON LEVEL WITH MRS PARSON'S COTTAGE THERE WAS A ROW OF 4 MUD AND WHITE-WASHED COTTAGES. IN 1885 THE FOUNDATION STONE OF THE CONGREGATIONAL CHAPEL WAS LAID BY MR JONATHAN T CHATER ON THE 5th OF NOVEMBER. IT IS A BRICK BUILDING WITH A ROSE WINDOW ON THE SOUTH SIDE. IN 1897 THE SUNDAY SCHOOL FOUNDATION STORE WAS LAID BY THE REV W,E MORRIS. MR LEWINGTON WAS THE SECRETARY AND WAS SUCCEDED BY MR E PAGE. THERE HAVE BEEN 2 RESIDENT MINISTERS MR CROSSLAND AND MR TOSELAND. AND AT PRESENT THE SERVICES ARE TAKEN BY LOCAL PREACHERS.
